channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inside the ICE Forum Where Agents Complain About Their Jobs
item.description: “I'm all for removing illegals, but snatching dudes off lawn mowers in Cali and leaving the truck and equipment just sitting there? Definitely not wor...

item.title: Meet Gizmo: a TikTok for interactive, vibe-coded mini apps
item.description: Gizmo's app is like a TikTok for vibe-coded mini apps...and it's a lot of fun.

item.title: Mistral's New Ultra-Fast Translation Model Gives Big AI Labs a Run for Their Money
item.description: “Too many GPUs makes you lazy,” says the French startup's vice president of science operations, as the company carves out a different path than the ma...

item.title: The Wayback Machine debuts a new plugin designed to fix the internet’s broken links problem
item.description: WordPress is helping the non-profit fight the scourge of "link rot."

item.title: Best Laptop Backpacks We’ve Tried and Tested (2026)
item.description: Whether you’re biking to the office or schlepping a camera to a shoot, a laptop bag is your constant companion. These WIRED-reviewed packs do the job.

item.title: ElevenLabs raises $500M from Sequioia at a $11 billion valuation
item.description: ElevenLabs' valuation has raised more than three times in the last twelve months.

item.title: After backlash, Adobe cancels Adobe Animate shutdown and puts app on ‘maintenance mode’
item.description: Adobe Animate will be discontinued on March 1, 2026, as Adobe shifts its focus to AI.

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX company town is getting a police department
item.description: The new department will have up to eight police officers and could be up and running in a few months.

item.title: Amazon to begin testing AI tools for film and TV production next month
item.description: Amazon MGM Studios will reportedly begin a closed beta program in March to test its AI tools to help with film and TV production.

item.title: AI SRE Resolve AI confirms $125M raise, unicorn valuation
item.description: The two-year-old startup confirms that it closed a Series A led by Lightspeed at $1 billion valuation.
